A FileAlreadyExistsException is thrown only if we remove the StandardCopyOption.ATOMIC_MOVE option.

choices.A: The green.txt file content is replaced by the yellow.txt file content and the yellow.txt file is deleted.
choices.D: A FileAlreadyExistsException is thrown at runtime.
choices.C: The file green.txt is moved to the /colors directory.
choices.B: The yellow.txt file content is replaced by the green.txt file content and an exception is thrown.
public abstract class Work implements Doable { public abstract void doSomething(String s) { } public void doYourThing(Boolean b) { } }
choices.E: public class Do implements Doable { public void doSomething(Integer i) { } public void doSomething(String s) { } public void doThat (String s) { } }
choices.D: public class Action implements Doable { public void doSomething(Integer i) { } public String doThis(Integer j) { } }
choices.A: public class Task implements Doable { public void doSomethingElse(String s) { } }
choices.C: public abstract class Job implements Doable { public void doSomething(Integer i) { } }

comments.content: * Option C, abstract method allowed not to implement interface methods

discussion.content:
Answer is CE,

Option A implements doSomethingElse(String s) instead doSomething(String s).
Option C abstract method allowed not to implement functions methods

CE is correct
C and E is the correct answwer
Answer C and E. A doesn't compile since method name is doSomethingElse and not doSomething. B isn't ok since doSomething is defined as abstract but provides implementation.

Selected Answer: A
Not tested, but I think :
- B doesn't compile because List.intStream() doesn't exist
- C doesn't compile because Stream.flatMap() expects a function as parameter, while a Stream is provided
- D almost compiles but doesn't : flatMapToInt() exists, though a wrong parameter is provided.
 Expected: Function<List<Integer>, IntStream>
 Provided: Function<List<Integer>, Stream<Integer>>
